projectId.description: Project ID. Only required when using a Personal Access Token.

extractor.description: A path to a custom extractor to use instead of the default one.

patterns.description: File glob patterns to your source code, used for keys extraction.

strictNamespace.description: Require namespace to be reachable, turn off if you don't use namespaces. (Default: true)

defaultNamespace.description: Default namespace used in extraction if not specified otherwise.

files.description: Define, which files should be pushed and attach language/namespace to them. By default Tolgee pushes all files specified here, you can filter them by languages and namespaces properties.

languages.description: Specifies which languages should be pushed from push.files.

namespaces.description: Specifies which namespaces should be pushed from push.files.

overrideKeyDescriptions.description: Override existing key descriptions from local files (only relevant for some formats).

convertPlaceholdersToIcu.description: Convert placeholders in local files to ICU format. (Default: true)

tagNewKeys.description: Specify tags that will be added to newly created keys.

path.description: Path to a folder where the localization files are stored. (Structure itself can be defined with `fileStructureTemplate`)

languages.description: List of languages to pull. Leave unspecified to export them all.

namespaces.description: List of namespaces to pull. Defaults to all namespaces.

states.description: List of translation states to include. Defaults all except untranslated.

tags.description: List of tags which to include.

excludeTags.description: List of tags which to exclude.

supportArrays.description: Export keys with array syntax (e.g. item[0]) as arrays.

emptyDir.description: Empty [path] folder before inserting pulled files.

delimiter.description: Structure delimiter to use. By default, Tolgee interprets `.` as a nested structure. You can change the delimiter, or disable structure formatting by not specifying any value to the option.

forceMode.description:
Specifies how to solve potential conflicts in the pushed data.

Options:

  `OVERRIDE` - update everything according to local files
  `KEEP` - create only non-existent strings, don't touch existing ones
  `NO_FORCE` - throw an error, if there are any conflict

path.description: File glob specifying which files to include.

format.description: Localization files format for push and pull operations.
